project_description: A Flutter todo management application utilizing Stacked architecture with comprehensive CRUD functionality for todo items. The app supports creating, editing, deleting, and marking todos as complete. It features a modular design with separate views for todo creation, editing, and listing, integrating reactive state management, form validation, and a clean, responsive user interface.
architecture_overview: The application implements a modular MVVM architecture using the Stacked framework, with clear separation of concerns between models, views, and view models. Key architectural components include reactive services, dependency injection via service locator, centralized state management, and a robust routing mechanism. The app leverages Stacked annotations for automatic code generation and dependency registration.

files.name: lib/app/app.dart
files.description: Defines the app structure using StackedApp annotation for routes, dependencies, bottom sheets, and dialogs. It includes routes (HomeView, StartupView), services (BottomSheetService, DialogService, NavigationService), bottom sheets (NoticeSheet), and dialogs (InfoAlertDialog). The file structure allows for easy addition of new services, routes, bottom sheets, and dialogs using the @stacked-import, @stacked-route, @stacked-service, @stacked-bottom-sheet, and @stacked-dialog annotations.

files.name: lib/l10n/localizations_extension.dart
files.description: This Dart file provides an extension on the BuildContext class to make it easier to access the current AppLocalizations instance, which is responsible for managing the application's localization and internationalization.

methods.name: localizations
methods.description: Retrieves the current AppLocalizations instance for the given BuildContext.

files.name: lib/app/app.bottomsheets.dart
files.description: This file is responsible for managing the bottom sheet UI in the Flutter application. It sets up the custom bottom sheet builders for different types of bottom sheets, allowing the application to display various types of bottom sheets as needed.

methods.name: setupBottomSheetUi
methods.description: Sets up the custom bottom sheet builders for different types of bottom sheets, allowing the application to display various types of bottom sheets as needed.

files.name: lib/l10n/supported_locales.dart
files.description: This Dart file is responsible for managing the supported locales and localization delegates for the Flutter application. It provides a centralized and reusable way to handle the internationalization (i18n) and localization (l10n) of the app.

methods.name: localizationsDelegates
methods.description: Returns a list of localization delegates that provide the translation and formatting logic for the application's strings.

methods.name: supportedLocales
methods.description: Returns a list of locales that the application supports for translation and formatting.

files.name: lib/app/app.router.dart
files.description: This file is responsible for managing the navigation and routing within the Flutter application. It defines the available routes, the corresponding views, and provides utility methods to navigate between these views.

methods.name: navigateToHomeView
methods.description: Navigates to the HomeView screen.

methods.name: navigateToStartupView
methods.description: Navigates to the StartupView screen.

methods.name: replaceWithHomeView
methods.description: Replaces the current route with the HomeView screen.

methods.name: replaceWithStartupView
methods.description: Replaces the current route with the StartupView screen.

files.name: lib/main/bootstrap.dart
files.description: This file is responsible for bootstrapping the Flutter application, setting up the necessary dependencies, and running the main app widget. It serves as the entry point for the application, ensuring a consistent initialization process across different app flavors.

methods.name: bootstrap
methods.description: This is the main entry point function that initializes the application. It sets up the app's flavor, ensures the WidgetsFlutterBinding is initialized, and configures the app's orientation, locator, dialog UI, and bottom sheet UI. Finally, it runs the main app widget provided by the caller.

files.name: lib/main/main_production.dart
files.description: This file is responsible for bootstrapping the production version of the application. It sets up the initial state and configuration for the app, ensuring it runs in the production environment.

methods.name: main
methods.description: The entry point of the application. It calls the `bootstrap` function to initialize the app and render the `AppView`.

files.name: lib/main/main_development.dart
files.description: This Dart file is responsible for bootstrapping the development version of the Flutter application. It sets up the application's entry point and configures the application flavor to be 'development'.

methods.name: main
methods.description: The main entry point of the application that initializes the development build of the app.

files.name: lib/models/enums/flavor.dart
files.description: This file defines an enum called `Flavor` with two values: `production` and `development`. It represents the different flavors or environments that the application can run in.

files.name: lib/services/analytic_service.dart
files.description: The AnalyticService class is a wrapper for analytics functionality in the application. It encapsulates the implementation of analytics tracking and provides a centralized interface for managing analytics-related operations.

methods.name: init
methods.description: Initializes the AnalyticService, preparing it for use.

files.name: lib/observer/screen_observer.dart
files.description: The ScreenObserver class is responsible for tracking the screen views of the application using the AnalyticService. It is a NavigatorObserver that listens for navigation events and logs screen transitions to the analytics service.

methods.name: didPush
methods.description: Tracks the screen view when a new route is pushed onto the navigation stack.

methods.name: didReplace
methods.description: Tracks the screen view when a route is replaced in the navigation stack.

methods.name: didPop
methods.description: Tracks the screen view when a route is popped from the navigation stack.

methods.name: _trackScreenView
methods.description: Logs the screen view to the AnalyticService based on the current route.

files.name: lib/ui/common/app_colors.dart
files.description: This Dart file defines a set of reusable color constants that represent the primary color palette of the application. These colors are used throughout the UI to ensure a consistent and branded visual experience.

files.description: The NoticeSheetModel class is responsible for managing the state and behavior of the notice bottom sheet UI component in the application. It provides the core functionality and business logic for displaying and interacting with the notice sheet.

files.name: lib/ui/common/ui_helpers.dart
files.description: This Dart file provides a collection of common UI helper functions and constants that are used throughout the Flutter application's user interface. It serves as a centralized location for managing and accessing various UI-related utilities, ensuring consistency and reusability across the codebase.
files.class_diagram:
@startuml
class UIHelpers {
  + const horizontalSpaceTiny: Widget
  + const horizontalSpaceSmall: Widget
  + const horizontalSpaceMedium: Widget
  + const horizontalSpaceLarge: Widget
  + const verticalSpaceTiny: Widget
  + const verticalSpaceSmall: Widget
  + const verticalSpaceMedium: Widget
  + const verticalSpaceLarge: Widget
  + const verticalSpaceMassive: Widget
  + const spacedDivider: Widget
  + verticalSpace(height: double): Widget
  + screenWidth(context: BuildContext): double
  + screenHeight(context: BuildContext): double
  + screenHeightFraction(context: BuildContext, dividedBy: int, offsetBy: double, max: double): double
  + screenWidthFraction(context: BuildContext, dividedBy: int, offsetBy: double, max: double): double
  + halfScreenWidth(context: BuildContext): double
  + thirdScreenWidth(context: BuildContext): double
  + quarterScreenWidth(context: BuildContext): double
  + getResponsiveHorizontalSpaceMedium(context: BuildContext): double
  + getResponsiveSmallFontSize(context: BuildContext): double
  + getResponsiveMediumFontSize(context: BuildContext): double
  + getResponsiveLargeFontSize(context: BuildContext): double
  + getResponsiveExtraLargeFontSize(context: BuildContext): double
  + getResponsiveMassiveFontSize(context: BuildContext): double
  + getResponsiveFontSize(context: BuildContext, fontSize: double, max: double): double
}
@enduml

methods.name: verticalSpace
methods.description: A function that creates a Widget with a specified vertical space.

methods.name: screenWidth
methods.description: A function that returns the width of the screen.

methods.name: getResponsiveFontSize

files.name: lib/ui/views/startup/startup_view.dart
files.description: The `StartupView` class in this file is responsible for the initial startup screen of the application. It is the main entry point for the user when they launch the app, displaying the app's logo and a loading indicator while the app's startup logic is being executed.

files.name: lib/ui/views/startup/startup_viewmodel.dart
files.description: The StartupViewModel class is responsible for handling the initial startup logic of the application. It is responsible for delaying the application launch by a few seconds and then navigating to the home view, which is the main entry point of the application.

methods.name: runStartupLogic
methods.description: This method is responsible for the core startup logic of the application. It delays the application launch by 3 seconds and then navigates to the home view using the NavigationService.

files.name: lib/utils/extensions/color_extension.dart

This extension simplifies the process of working with color-related functionality in the application, improving developer productivity and maintainability.

The main purpose of this class is to provide a centralized way to access and check the current application flavor, enabling the application to behave differently based on the specific environment it is running in.

methods.name: formatListMap

dependencies.name: stacked
dependencies.purpose: Stacked architecture for state management and routing

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
participant AppView
participant CreateTodoView
participant CreateTodoViewModel
participant TodoService
participant EditTodoView
participant EditTodoViewModel

User -> AppView: Launch App
User -> CreateTodoView: Open Todo Creation
CreateTodoView -> CreateTodoViewModel: Initialize
User -> CreateTodoView: Enter Todo Details
CreateTodoViewModel -> TodoService: Validate and Save Todo
TodoService --> CreateTodoViewModel: Todo Saved
User -> EditTodoView: Select Todo to Edit
EditTodoView -> EditTodoViewModel: Load Todo Details
EditTodoViewModel -> TodoService: Retrieve Todo
User -> EditTodoView: Modify Todo
EditTodoViewModel -> TodoService: Update Todo
@enduml
state_management_flow: The application uses Stacked's reactive state management approach, with ViewModels serving as the primary state holders. Each view (CreateTodoView, EditTodoView) has a corresponding ViewModel that manages its state, handles user interactions, and communicates with services. The TodoService acts as a centralized state manager for todo items, providing methods for adding, updating, deleting, and retrieving todos. State changes trigger automatic UI updates through reactive programming principles.
navigation_flow: Navigation is implemented using Stacked's routing mechanism, with predefined routes for todo creation and editing. The AppView serves as the main entry point, managing navigation between different views. Navigation between screens is handled through the NavigationService, which allows programmatic navigation with optional parameters. The routing system supports passing data between views and maintains a clean, type-safe navigation approach.
